programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les' Revenge: Seth feels Les's wrath after he spends company money on a controversial impulse purchase. (S3, ep 7)

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The Top Ten Alien Influencers: Did a biblical patriarch receive instructions from 200 angels, and was Egypt's most controversial Pharaoh an extraterrestrial being? (S16, ep 1)

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.desc: Henry Cole, Allen Millyard and Guy Willison visit top collector Stuart Imber before preparing to sell their latest finds at the Fairford Steam. (S2, ep 6)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Dueling and Dealing: The guys head out for a little friendly competition. Also, Apollo 11 documents and a Harley-Davidson 1962 Topper find their way into the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Sucker Punch: Les frantically searches for a buyer in order to win a bet with Seth. Later, a revelation sends a pair of customers on a rampage. (S3, ep 11)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Melted Gold: The Gold family and their employees get ready to haggle as members of the public continue to bring them weird and wonderful items in the hope of raising some cash. (S3, ep 12)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: I Quit!: Les and Seth face off with Ashley in a battle for control that has lasting consequences for the business. (S3, ep 13)

programme.desc: A Hole Lot of Trouble: When rain derails an outside game of catch, someone suggests they play inside. This prompts Izzy to lead the group through her wildly imaginative worst case scenario. (S3 Ep17)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: A Tall Tale: After Owen's BBF, Noah, goes through a growth spurt, Owen fears losing his friend and takes drastic action. (S3 Ep18)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Chews Wisely: When the floor ends up covered in gum on the day of a big bubble blowing contest, Sugar decides she might help herself win by helping her friends get stuck to the floor. (S3 Ep19)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: A Dingo Ate My Duncan: When all their classmates are replaced with well behaved Australian doppelgangers in a school exchange program, Lightning and Cody start getting suspicious. (S3 Ep20)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Erase Your Head: Gwen orders a personality modifying ray to tone her perky parents, but decides to test it on the class first. (S3 Ep21)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Teacher, Soldier, Chef, Spy: When Beth, Duncan and Izzy break Chef's new VR helmet they have to recreate his game world to keep him from ever finding out the truth. (S3 Ep22)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Thingameroo: When a lack of motivation threatens to sink the kids' chances in the Sportslete Athlaction Awards, they create the greatest mascot of all time to boost school spirit. (S3 Ep23)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: CodE.T.: When Cody gets sick, the kids want to send a message back to his home planet in the hope that they can save him, but Courtney is not in favour of the plan. (S3 Ep24)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Sound of a Lemming: Grizzy snatches the last jar of chocolate spread out from under the noses of the Lemmings. In exchange, he offers them the toy stuck inside the lid: a mini-flute. (S1 Ep38)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear in the Wind: The Lemmings play a new game but interrupt Grizzy watching his favourite TV show. (S1 Ep39)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Construction Bear: Grizzy decides to build a building to impress she-bear. (S1 Ep40)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Kung Fu Lemmings: The Lemmings draw inspiration from lessons they find in a martial arts book and start breaking every wooden object they can get their hands on. (S1 Ep41)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: A Midsummer Bear's Dream: Grizzy dreams that he's a valiant knight but is woken up by the Lemmings blasting music. Grizzy has only one desire: pick up his dream where he left off. (S1 Ep42)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Manufacturing Secret: Grizzy has run out of chocolate spread. He realises that the Lemmings are making their own. If they can make it, then why can't he? But first, he needs the recipe! (S1 Ep43)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bling Bling Bear: Inspired by a magazine showing a man offering a diamond to a woman, Grizzy imagines himself offering the ranger's engagement ring to his beloved she-bear. (S1 Ep44)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Intellectual Bear: When he accidentally sticks a computer microprocessor to his head, Grizzy is transformed into a being capable of predicting events to come far in advance. (S1 Ep45)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Voodoo Blanket: The Lemmings prepare a dream afternoon snack with the last jar of chocolate spread in the cupboard. (S1 Ep46)

programme.title: Team Jay
programme.desc: Identity Crisis / Tiny Town: Duke tries to find the right personality to be popular, but after a while he forgets who he really is and has an identity crisis. (S1 Ep5)

programme.title: Team Jay
programme.desc: Portals / Ready Player Jay: Mildew Mold and his evil sidekick, Hannibal, invent a portal device. They kidnap Jay and use him as bait for the rest of the team. (S1 Ep6)

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug...
programme.desc: ...and Cat Noir: Glaciator 2: Unable to declare her love to Adrien, Marinette turns to Cat Noir to help her rehearse. But their closeness is not to everyone's liking... (S4 Ep15)

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug

programme.title: Mermicorno: Starfall

programme.title: Unicorn Academy

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: It Takes Two To Talent: Felicity can't decide what to do for the Mythlandia Talent Contest, while Miguel channels his guitar skills. (S1 Ep7)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.desc: The Case of the Sleepover Secret / The Case of the Big Mouth Challenge: Pixie is furious when something she privately told Ava is made public. (S1 Ep3)

programme.title: Shasha and Milo: Shorts

programme.title: Mermicorno: Starfall

programme.title: Unicorn Academy

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: The Green-Eyed Monster: Miguel invites Chippy, a cute chipmunk-like creature, to join him and Felicity on their friend-iversary, but Chippy isn't all she seems! (S1 Ep17)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Broken Back Kotter: Izzy nominates Chef for the Daycare Professional of the Year award and will do whatever it takes to see him win. As it turns out, it takes a lot. (S3 Ep3)

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.desc: Where Does the Dream Go!? Look for Super Saiyan God!: Beerus tries to discover the unbeatable foe from his dream, and Supreme Kai seeks information about Beerus and Goku. (S1 Ep3)

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of...
programme.desc: ...Ladybug & Cat Noir: Dark Cupid: It's Valentine's Day and Kim's broken heart takes a dark turn. Ladybug and Cat Noir have their own feelings put to the test. (S1 Ep5)

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of...

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Student Becomes The Teacher: Chef is knocked unconscious right before a school board evaluator shows up for a big review. Now Owen has to fill in so Chef doesn't lose his teaching licence. (S2 Ep10)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Beth And The Beanstalk: After having a chocolate bar confiscated by Chef, Beth finds herself in a parallel giant world and aims to get back her now giant chocolate bar. (S2 Ep11)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: The A-bok-bok-bokalypse: When chicken pox sweeps through the school, the kids visit the Chicken Queen to apologise for past misdeeds and hopefully procure an antidote before it's too late! (S2 Ep12)

programme.title: Total Dramarama

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Say Hello to My Little Friends: After telling the kids he will not miss them over the long weekend, Chef locks himself into the school and finds out he was very, very wrong. (S3 Ep12)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: WaterHose-Five: It's the hottest day of the year and a broken air conditioner leads to a water battle of epic proportions to determine who controls the garden hose. (S3 Ep13)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Cody the Barbarian: Cody is set to inherit a video game empire from his long lost uncle, but only if he and his friends have what it takes to conquer a fantastical live action video game. (S3 Ep14)

programme.title: Total Dramarama

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings

programme.title: Abadas

programme.title: Yield to the Night
programme.desc: 1956. Drama. Director: J Lee Thompson. Stars Diana Dors, Yvonne Mitchell, Michael Craig & Geoffrey Keen. A condemned murderess relives key events while waiting for the hangman's noose. [S]

programme.title: The Siege of Sidney Street
programme.desc: 1960. Drama. Directors: Monty Berman & Robert S. Baker. Stars Donald Sinden & Nicole Berger. As armed police surround a house in East London, a girl recalls the events that lead to the situation. [S]

programme.title: Police Dog
programme.desc: 1955. Drama. Starring Joan Rice, Tim Turner & Sandra Dorne. When his colleague is shot dead by a burglar, PC Frank Mason vows for justice. After becoming a dog-handler, he finds a new partner. [S]

programme.title: Beyond The Truth
programme.desc: Alien Encounter. This documentary attempts to answer what was found in the woods in Virginia. (S1, E04)

programme.title: British Rails are Long and Fast
programme.desc: 1969. Directed by Bob Privett. Intended as a sales tool for manufacturers, this short film details the production, installation and maintenance for long welded track in use on British Railways.

programme.title: Danny Boy
programme.desc: 1941. Drama. A successful singer in America returns to Britain during the Blitz to find her ex-husband and son have fallen on hard times. Starring David Farrar and Ann Todd. [S]

programme.title: Variety Jubilee
programme.desc: 1943. Musical. Kit (Ellis Irving) and Joe Swann (Reginald Purdell) are variety stars. Kits' son is killed in the First World War but the grandson revives the music hall and joins the RAF musical. [S]

programme.title: Forbidden
programme.desc: 1949. Drama. Directed by George King. Stars Douglass Montgomery, Hazel Court & Patricia Burke. An ex-serviceman plans to escape his faithless wife. [S]

programme.title: The Small Back Room
programme.desc: 1949. Drama. Directors Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger. Stars David Farrar, Jack Hawkins and Kathleen Byron. The best bomb disposal expert must battle his inner self, during the German raids. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life Relax, Relax!
programme.desc: 1961. A light-hearted look at the various relaxation methods on offer to people.

programme.title: Commandos Strike at Dawn
programme.desc: 1942. War. Directed by John Farrow. Stars Anna Lee, Paul Muni & Ray Collins. A Norwegian fisherman, enraged at the Nazi atrocities against his village, sets out to seek revenge and restore peace. [S]

programme.title: An Inspector Calls
programme.desc: 1954. Crime. Director: Guy Hamilton. Stars Alastair Sim, Olga Lindo, Eileen Moore. The Birling family are rich and complacent. It is 1912, and the impending war has yet to fall across their lives. [S]

programme.title: What's On TPTV With Noel
programme.desc: Founder of Talking Pictures TV and one half of the Footage Detectives, Noel Cronin, shares shows and films not to be missed at the end of April and beginning of May. [S]

programme.title: The Edgar Wallace Mystery Theatre
